title: Paypal | SDE 3
content:
* Education: Tier 2 college
* Years of Experience: 8
* Prior Experience: Product based company (US)
* Company: PayPal
* Title/Level: Software Engineer 3
* Location: Bangalore
* Salary: 36,00,000/-
* Relocation/Signing Bonus: 0
* Stock bonus: 60K USD (3 years)
* Bonus: 3,50,000/-
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 90,00,000/- (56,00,000 first year)
* Benefits: usual benifits

Is it lowballed ? Any PayPal employee there, could you please confirm ?

title: Salesforce MTS Offer
content:
Education: B.Tech CS in Tier-2 College
Years of Experience: 2.4 years
Prior Experience: SDE 1 at Saas startup
Date of the Offer: Oct 2024
Company: Salesforce (Service cloud)
Role : Backend developer
Previous techstack : Java spring boot
Title: MTS (Member of technical staff)
Location: Bangalore (flexible according to team, no rigid rules like come to office 3 times a week)
Salary/Base: ₹32,00,000
Bonus: ₹3,20,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: $50,000 for 4 years (equally vested)
Total Comp: ₹45,70,000
Previous CTC: ₹24,00,000 (₹20,00,000 Base + ₹4,00,000 ESOPs per year)
Benefits: Standard salesforce benifits 
LC/CP states : around 850 questions on LC, 500 on CF (used to do in college), knight in lc , CF max rating specialist, 4 star on CC. Haven't solved much in atcoder.
Preparation strategy: 
Algorithms : 
    Used to solve leetcode regularly in year starting and gave contests to keep my coding skills sharp. When my interviews got scheduled I just went through some standard medium/Hard problems. For most of the companies doing leetcode is enough. But please do questions in depth rathar than doing it for increasing the count of questions. Please give contests on LC. Always try to attempt harder questions than your current level. 
System design : 
     For LLD I have gone through online blogs and youTube but mainly I frame my answers according to my learnings till now. Ideally at 2+ years exp you are already aware of most of the basics of LLD so go through the basics of LLD and then apply your day to day Dev skills to frame the answer (please refer some standard questions online and then frame the answer that way). 
	 For HLD you can follow CodeKarle youTube channel, that covers all the basics of hld and he has covered all the standard questions. You can watch those and form your solutions according to that because any question can be answered using basics of hld and standard questions that are already available on youtube.

One more important note please give some mock interviews for algorithms and system design both and do not take hr round very lightly, please prepare for behavioural questions seriously before your hr/hm round. 

How Did I apply : I applied thourgh referral, one of college seniors referred me in August end.
Other companies that I interviewed with : Zepto and got a call from Goldman for associate but my joining date was already very near by that time. Got ghosted by Zepto after two rounds. 

Accepted the offer as I am getting very good hike according to my current TC(and good tag on resume) and didn't get to interview with any other company which can beat this TC. My only concern is if sf has good work or not (have read some online reviews that work is not that good here). Will add interview exp in future.

title: Docusign | Senior Software Engineer | Bangalore
content:
Education: B.Tech Tier-1.5 College
Years of Experience: 7.5 years
Prior Experience: Senior at one of the FAANG level companies
Date of the Offer: Dec 2024
Company: Docusign
Title: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore
Salary/Base: ₹70,00,000 (including PF)
Annual Bonus: ~₹6,80,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: $110,000 for 4 years 
Joining Bonus: ₹10,00,000
Total Comp: Roughly 99L + 10L joining bonus

This was their initial offer. Didnt negotiate as i had already made up my mind on accepting another offer.
Overall, the experience was really nice and the team was working on cool stuffs, wasnt an easy decision at all. 

The panel and recruiter were the nicest set of people i have met. Would totally recommend :)
